website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price point for a digital scanner that can handle multiple types of film negatives and slides.
pros: Gives you the option of scanning all kinds of negatives and slides, including 35 millimeter, 110, 126, and Super 8
Delivers an output resolution up to 22 megapixels
Doesn't require a connection to a computer, as it stores images on a memory card or in internal memory
Ships with speed loading adapters to make the job go faster
cons: Seems to pick up and magnify any dust on the negatives
Only supports up to 32 gigabyte memory cards

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: the reader for the memory card didn't work, requiring me to use internal memory only. The internal memory was enough for less than 50 scans on average, making it a pain to stop scanning, then transfer the images to ,y computer, then delete the images from internal memory, and then start scanning again. I have returned this item and will get something else. Image quality was ok. Scanner itself seemed ok, the plastic guides for loading the slides were a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl - NYC

customer_reviews.title: Junk toy
customer_reviews.text: It works, barely. More a toy than a professional scanner. Not worth the money. After 6 months stored in the box dust on the lens makes the photos not attractive. The cleaning brush only cleans the back light, not the lens. Being an engineer and professional photographer, I took it apart and cleaned it. Next issue is the circuit board. It hardly communicates and crashes often when transferring files to a computer. Takes hours to scan a roll of film and transfer to the computer. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had several bags of slides from his mission trips in Europe and Israel from when he was younger. We wanted to have the slides transferred to photos, but weren't sure which ones to have printed. There were over 2,000 slides so the cost to send them off to another company would be astrological. I was able to transfer all of the slides to a SD card and surprise my husband for Christmas. This way he gets to pick out the slides he wants to have printed/enlarged and he also get to see all of the slides. It took several hours to upload this many slides, but it was worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: wendy franklin

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while and died
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to digitize my parent's slides and negatives. Like most projects of this type, I started and then put it aside for months. The scanner worked OK - not great capture quality, but certainly good enough. Then, after sitting in its box for a few months, I dragged it out today to start again, and it no longer works. All that shows up on the screen are colored lines, so the image capture device has failed. If you're looking for a quality slide scanner, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Kolb

customer_reviews.title: Results not that good
customer_reviews.text: Scanned slides are very grainy as comparted to my old Epson photo scanner. Pros: This is a very fast way to scan a lot of slides! Cons: Unacceptable results with very grainy photos as compared to old Epson flat bed photo scanner, which is extremely slow hence why this devise was purchased. Tried all available settings to get a better result and none could come close to the results from my old Epson flatbed photo scanner. Even running the result through photo editing software could still not produce acceptable images for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nice Pony

customer_reviews.title: Digital Converter, Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: While this small scanner provides a barely passable scan, the image quality leaves much to be desired. I adjusted the images as much as was possible but they were still so contrasty and low quality that I will end up using it only for images that are relatively unimportant. I have to wonder if I can gerry-rig something with my iPhone and a rear light source that would give far better quality than this item.
customer_reviews.author: Shar G

customer_reviews.title: I knew it wasn't going to be "photo scanner" beautiful (i did comparisons at home)
customer_reviews.text: Tried multiple negatives, of varying age with the same result. "Yellowed" scans. I knew it wasn't going to be "photo scanner" beautiful (i did comparisons at home), but I couldnt pull the yellow out of anything with iPhoto or the machine's clunky 'editor' itself. If you want fast, lackluster but easy conversions...you may dig this. I returned it the next day. I'm actually shocked it has such a great rating. Maybe I got a bum unit, but I wasn't taking the chance with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for long
customer_reviews.text: Scanned about 500 slides and now the viewer screen is showing multicolored lines and the slide image is not visible. Have only used the product twice since I bought it last month. Still have a lot of slides to convert, but cannot because it's not working anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Film type Not in manual.
customer_reviews.text: My slides were showing as negatives. Read manual over and over. Started scrolling the menu and found Film type. You have to do this if you want slides in the correct colors. It is NOT in the manual. Please don't curse zonoz until you scroll to Film Type. Also the so called speed loaders scan a single slide based on the manual. But if you insert a second and third slide in the adapter, the third will push second into the correct position. Is this an undocumented feature or an accident, don't know.
customer_reviews.author: ace mario

customer_reviews.title: The focus is off, and the colors are off ...
customer_reviews.text: The focus is off, and the colors are off. Totally unsatisfactory. Most Amazon products are as advertised, but not this one. I finally had to get a macro lens (from Amazon) and copy the slides with my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin C. Rencher

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. More than adequate quality for the archive purpose intended. Some slides and negatives resulted in very good quality images. Results will be dependent on quality of your negatives and slides (goes without saying) so don't expect this little beauty to make a silk purse out of a sow's ear. You can use photo editing for that. Know that it is a real time saver. Captures and saves slides/negs about as fast as you can feed them and push a button twice. Price vs. value - 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dale D.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to save old slides
customer_reviews.text: We inherited a bunch of really old slides from my husband's parents after they passed. This device gave us the opportunity to save all of them to a hard drive and we can now share the images will the entire family. We are all very happy to be able to share those precious memories.
customer_reviews.author: WyoGirl

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Really has helped us with a daunting project of reviewing old fam slides and to download to PC, those we might choose to save.. Pro: Easy to use with PC or TV. No need for the old carousel projector and screen set up. Con: Tedious to put in slides
customer_reviews.author: Eliza T

customer_reviews.title: This Does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: What you get is a shoddy 1K picture of the slide! Seriously... what are you going to do with that. I bought this thinking I could get a decent digitized picture of the slide> So that I could throw my slides out... This is not the product.
customer_reviews.author: Thekeithfan

customer_reviews.title: Oh the nostalgia!
customer_reviews.text: I got as a gift for my husband and he loves it. He had boxes of old slides and negatives the wanted to digitalize, and this has worked very well. He says it's easy to use, and oh the nostalgia he's had seeing old family pics from the 60's again!
customer_reviews.author: SUZEQ

customer_reviews.title: The scanner is not worth to buy
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write review but this scanner is very disappointed. So many problems with this brand 1. Sometimes the screen blank out (see nothing) 2. Sometimes the screen turns upside down. 3. Sometimes the light flickering 4. Some times the scan pictures yellow. 5. Sometimes can not insert film strip through.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use controls right on the unit allowing you ...
customer_reviews.text: just finished converting over eighteen hundred 110 & 35mm slides to digital. These slides were my parents from their time in the Vietnam war through the early '80s. Very easy to use controls right on the unit allowing you to flip the image top to bottom or to the mirror image if you put the slide in upside down or backwards. Also allows you to adjust the color and brightness manually, though it was rarely needed thanks to the unit's automatic adjustments it performs as soon as a slide is put in place. Got 'em done over the weekend and saved hundreds of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Digitized over 700 slides and am quite happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: T. Laszlo

customer_reviews.title: Coolest product out there!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough great things about this product. In fact several of my friends have also purchased these as a result of what I have shared with them! It let me open up a whole new vault of photos from the past. Easy to use and save the photos. I just wish I had this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Julz

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for quickly scanning hundreds of family slides - nice to be able to see what is on them. Not enough settings to make the highest quality scans, but enough for good on-screen viewing and sharing. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Quartz

customer_reviews.title: I like this
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I've read some of the negative reviews and they may be totally right. I think they are way more picky than me. I cleared out over a thousand slides with this in a few days and I am thrilled I'm giving 4 not 5 stars because I found the instructions hard to understand
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Mcauliffe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Decent scans. I had some old negative, some from the 60's, and colors fade unevenly (I think blue goes first). Anyway, some color correction post scanning did the trick. The only negative I could not save was poorly exposed to begin with. It helps if you have a brush designed to remove dust from film. The screen on the scanner is too small too see small bits of dust. Considering the cost and size of flatbed scanner, I am happy with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Luciano

customer_reviews.title: This product is super simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is super simple and easy to use!! I was digging out all the old pictures and had high ambition to digitize. Used this to digitize several rolls of negatives. But realized that I didn't not have the skill or patience to be successful, sent to a service. But for a few rolls very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: We've done about 4000 slides on this so far and it's straightforward to use and the transfer quality seems good. Small and compact, too! Bought it because it was top rated on a few websites I checked out. Would buy again - in fact, if you have a large quantity of slides to do, would be good to have two so a buddy can work on them at the same time. Make sure you have a slide viewing device in addition as the screen is quite small.
customer_reviews.author: Spaezel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted to start scanning my old slides ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted to start scanning my old slides and negatives. A couple of things about scanning, make sure to blow the dust off the lens every now and then. Also if you are scanning slides remember that you will increase the contrast somewhat. I use Photoshop to help cut back the contrast. This is not just this unit but almost any time a slide is scanned.
customer_reviews.author: Barry L. Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Good slide converter
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used this to scan slides. The quality seems to be as good as the slides that were done at Costco. Some slides fit better than others in the slide holder. Just be careful if there is a tight fit. Another tip for users is to use compressed air to remove the dust from the slide before you scan them. Do not get overly aggressive with the compressed air or you could possibly freeze the slide and damage it. I have done this a few times with no signs of permanent damage. Using the compressed air, It probably takes about 10 minutes to convert 36 slides.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a professional level device, but it does what it's supposed to and seems to work fine. Hopefully it will last a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Newby

customer_reviews.title: Wolverine F2D is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other converters and was very disappointed with the results. The F2D worked perfect from the start and I can't wait when I can't get outside and I will have an excuse to set inside and get my slides converted to play on my DVD player. I have already recommended this device to several friends. This is one "gadget" that lives up to the ad and is worth every penny. If you have slides sitting around you will not find a better machine that works as well or is easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kirtley J. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: but was pretty limited and hard to get the outcome I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This worked for what I needed, it would have made it much easier if there was a way to save directly to my computer rather than having to save to the unit first and then uploading. Also, it did allow adjustments for exposure and color, but was pretty limited and hard to get the outcome I wanted. Overall thought for the price, it did serve my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vert good for your family media.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for your family photos and negatives. I tried to use with for a friend who is writing a book and the color replication isn't exact, so it's probably not useful for professional applications. The on-screen adjustments for pictures are very basic, you'll probably do better using a computer-based program like Photoshop for more precise adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to claims made for it
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to getting started with scanning my slides with this product. I have a Pana-Vue Lighted SIlde Viewer that I've been using to sort which slides to scan, so I have a very good idea of the qualities of the slide. But when I ran the first 1/2 dozen through the Wolverine, all sorts of unhappy results ensued. Two slides had central areas out of focus, others were crazily different hues. We a few slides through multiple times, trying its color and brightness functions, but the images were never more than irritating. Its going back today.
customer_reviews.author: Peregrinator

customer_reviews.title: This unit does a good job of digitizing slides and negatives
customer_reviews.text: This unit does a good job of digitizing slides and negatives. I'm surprised by the reviews that say you need to touch up the scans in PS or similar, because I would have expected that anyway. I'm digitizing my entire collection of photos and there hasn't been a single one from my flatbed scanner that didn't also need considerable editing in PS Elements. This unit returns sizeable images that are quite satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: patriot1123

customer_reviews.title: So easy - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's manual and one at a time, but it is simple and it works really well. Just save to an SD chip and put the chip in your computer and save. Great little device!
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Clunky controls but did a good job converting slides once you learn it.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job and works quickly. Holds only 44 slides and then they have to be saved to your computer, delete all files in unit and start over, so it is a bit clunky, but once you learn it, it does the job. I did 450 slides in a few hours and it was a great investment. Now, we can make copies and pass the around easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very good unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good for the price. Shove an sd card into it and push buttons, and it stores automatically adjusted images the the card. Then attach to computer and dump the contents of the card to the computer. Resolution is very good. It will work with a usb style power cord/supply, and does not need to be attached to computer. View screen is nice. Decent product for the price. Much better than previous generations of cheaper scanners.
customer_reviews.author: Old geek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine. The display screen is small but easily remedied by importing to your computer and viewing there
customer_reviews.author: Richard Saint Clare

customer_reviews.title: Great converter if you have a lot of slides to convert
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for converting lots of slides to digital images. I converted 118 slides in a little over an hour. This doesn't include the time it takes to rename and color correct each one. But that's something that I can do whenever. I just wanted to get them all converted. I have a lot more to convert before I start the renaming and fixing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: As simple as it gets and equal to those digital services
customer_reviews.text: As simple as it gets and equal to those digital services. Not a single glitch after 2000+ negatives run through. If you want to mess with the RGB and exposure, also very intuitive - but not necessary. I use the default most of the time. At 2.5MP, more than enough detail on a 22" monitor. the lowest price I was quoted for my 3500+ negatives was over $1000. This for under $100. Perfect - and no chances of lost or destroyed shipping back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Won Hung Low

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Great, perfect solution to transfer the hundreds of seriously ...
customer_reviews.text: So Far So Great, perfect solution to transfer the hundreds of seriously old slides the wife got from her step farther, very easy to use and the end results is pretty awesome considering the slides are from the 50's and 60's, awesome way to look at history!!
customer_reviews.author: Smootherworld

customer_reviews.title: It's terrific
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is easy to use, converts slides quickly and allows you to adjust color balance and exposure. Some of our slides were from the 1950s and had turned quite red. The color balance feature helped me get a fairly natural picture back. I would say, if you have a pile of old slides you want to digitize, you'll love this little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ysteb

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product
customer_reviews.text: Found this very helpful. Was able to scan over 800 slides and over 1000 negatives very quickly and easily. Particularly liked the tool to clean before each use. Had a previous product that did not do slides and was very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Derry C. Juneja

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use, really good quality, quick and efficient. Only one thing I'd like to see, if it could set the date and time. When I import the photos into Apple's Photos app it doesn't put the right date on the pictures, puts in something like June 2011 on all the pictures. Other than that it's a really good product, works well!
customer_reviews.author: Math Geek

customer_reviews.title: Lower your expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I felt the was not what I expected. Perhaps I was expecting too much. In was specifically disappointed with negatives. There quality was much better with slides.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty simple to figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to figure out how to use it, and it seems to be producing decent quality images considering how damaged the originals were. Have tried it on slides and negatives. I did not do any color adjustment or anything, because i prefer to use a larger screen and software for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tubin

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner and good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice scanner. It does what it claims to do. Because each slide needs to be inserted individually it is as little cumbersome and it takes a while to accomplish the task. However, with a little practice, this can be accomplished well. Picture quality is good. It is relatively easy to use. I would not hesitate to recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham  Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Watch return dates
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2nd time turning on ... tried to get refund but wasn’t able to drop it off in the time given (which was my fault) life gets in the way... however I don’t feel like it should have broke that quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wolverine F2D Super 20MP 4-in-1 film to digital photo's
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and is easy. The learning curve is very small. I used it on some 35mm slides that had been lost for 40+ years. they where almost like reliving the time, that was good and bad. But the Wolverine F2D did a supper job. I purchased it after reading reviews on several different ones. Thanks guys, good job.
customer_reviews.author: chewy

customer_reviews.title: No cropping adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to use, I just found default cropping to be excessive and no way to adjust took away from the products usability
customer_reviews.author: WERNER SLABBER

customer_reviews.title: This unit does a good job with both color negatives and color slides
customer_reviews.text: This unit does a good job with both color negatives and color slides. The digital files look as good as the originals from 35 years ago. Since the unit works without connection to a computer, it is very convenient to set up and put aside when working with batches of slides and negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Karl D. Feintuch

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use slide converter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I was just looking to recover the images on some 40 year old slides. This device made it really easy. The quality is good but not great even on the slides that are well preserved. I expect with some tweaking I could get better images. Just having them in digital files is more than satisfactory. The ease of use makes the product well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Macpilot7

customer_reviews.title: ... photos from old negatives with this and it works great. It is fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been pulling photos from old negatives with this and it works great. It is fast and easy to use. Photos look as expected -- the negatives are quite old. I am also going to use it to upload old photos from slides my mother has. It is so fun to digitize these old pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Adearden

customer_reviews.title: Good and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father for his birthday. He said it easy to use and works great. If the original picture is of decent quality then the digital version is good.
customer_reviews.author: LauraPh

customer_reviews.title: I am still working with it but I am pleased with all the results
customer_reviews.text: It seems to do the job it says it will. I did a comparison between its general setting to its adjusted setting. I found that my computer would not let me further adjust the adjusted negatives. I also found that I needed to change the setting depending on the negatives condition. I am still working with it but I am pleased with all the results.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Returns are closed after one month. Make sure you ...
customer_reviews.text: Returns are closed after one month. Make sure you use it before returns are closed. We did 25 slides and then red streak appeared on the pictures. We were ready to return it by December 6th. We had ordered it Oct 20th, so we were too late. We hope the manufacturer will take it back. If not for the red streaks in the pictures, it operated well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DIGITIZE QUICK & EASY
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Easy to follow instructions. Love the ability to reverse slide photos without having to remove. I digitized several hundred color 35mm slides in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Genesio

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it .. wish they would make these to scan the old 620 film .. have so many I would to have a picture of ... but this machine is fast .. easy to use .. the 110 and 126 and 35 look good .. a good purchse ..
customer_reviews.author: seashells4kathy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a cent!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality scans with flare at the center and dark at the edges. Uneven lighting!
customer_reviews.author: John Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: Nice Device...
customer_reviews.text: Really neat little device, fairly good image transfer with slides...all I have used it for so far...instructions are good yet sparse and concise...easy to set up and use by following the directions...k
customer_reviews.author: Kim Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and value!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good quality images. In a few hours was able to scan and upload 100-odd slides for my mother. Would've been much costlier and much more hassle to farm this out. Very pleased! Next project will be to digitize a bunch of old negatives we no longer have prints of!
customer_reviews.author: ktblax

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for..
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and fast! I have old slides from the 70s and 80s and some of them have color fading. The Wolverine isn't great on getting the color right and that is the one area where it is a little time consuming but I wasn't paying for great. I just wanted to see if I wanted any of my old pictures and memories and for that this is a wonderful little machine! The viewing screen is a little small but it is so easy to upload the pictures to my computer (can do it very fast and can redo if necessary) so it isn't that big of a deal breaker. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michele CC

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner.  So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am having a blast scanning my family slides and can't wait to work on the movies. This is super easy to use and the scan quality is terrific. I am spreading the word about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jgiove

customer_reviews.title: a most my dad use these everyday since I get ...
customer_reviews.text: a most my dad use these everyday since I get it and have being rock solid. have preserve around 7000 negative.
customer_reviews.author: MrAgapiGC

customer_reviews.title: This works ok but seems to get dust in it ...
customer_reviews.text: This works ok but seems to get dust in it that I can't get out no matter what I try... and I know the dust isn't on the film. Also, sometimes messes up the exposure but overall it's ok for the cost
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great little item
customer_reviews.text: What a great little item. I have been going through lots of old slides and converting them to my computer. I love that it stands alone and you can save on a card then transfer to computer when you want to.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wren

customer_reviews.title: Great little slide viewer!
customer_reviews.text: This little device lets you look at each slide individually and save the ones you want onto an SD card. You have to feed each slide but it was simple to feed each slide one after the other and there was never any problems with it - very consistent. I was able to go through about 1200 slides in a few days! I bought another viewer, but the tray didn't fit very well, and after jamming it a few times, I bought this one. You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Happy trails 2 u

customer_reviews.title: Wolverine is great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastically easy way of transferring slides, negatives and film into digital images and be able to preserve fun memories. It's very easy to use. I had tried another gadget, which was not user friendly and did not work at all at the end of many attempts. I highly recommend Wolverine. The price is fair too.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Valladares

customer_reviews.title: I just received this Wolverine F2D Super Plus via Amazon and it is DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: I just received this Wolverine F2D Super Plus via Amazon and it is DEFECTIVE. When I insert the slide, nothing is displayed and when I try to save the image, nothing is saved to either the device or to my SD card . Either the display screen or the lens on this product is defective. (I've attached a photo that shows the unit I received with power to with and slides inserted with a BLANK screen). I was hoping to use this product for a presentation this week but will have to buy something else locally since this product is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Very good scan quality. Durable product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this scanner on a collection of about 1000 35mm color slides from the 40's through the 80's. It works very well and I've gotten pretty efficient and processing them. The family is very pleased with the scan quality of the digital images.
customer_reviews.author: Schrammbo of SFBay

customer_reviews.title: Works very good. I'm converting old 35mm slides into digital pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very good. I'm converting old 35mm slides into digital pictures and it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: W. Haig

customer_reviews.title: display
customer_reviews.text: after 2.5 months the display went blank (white) flickered then the menu inverted. Contacted the manufacture, waiting response. Amazon only has a 30 day return policy. The manufacture has a 1 yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and it works!
customer_reviews.text: This item does what it is supposed to do and is very easy to use. It is advisable to be prepared to process your scans in a program like Photoshop after you are done importing them into your computer if you want better results.
customer_reviews.author: Cgeorge

customer_reviews.title: Could fix it but the quality of the scans is too poor. Even if I fixed it the scans are ...
customer_reviews.text: Just opened it yesterday for Christmas. Converted about 30 slides then the bulb inside stopped working. Could fix it but the quality of the scans is too poor. Even if I fixed it the scans are no good.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P

customer_reviews.title: it works real easy. I would recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I got my Wolverine F2D this afternoon , and have already saved about 300 slides to my Sandisk.Read the manual first, it works real easy. I would recommend this product to anyone.If your pictures are to dark or light, or need other adjustments get a photo software from some body and fix them. This product dose what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: pfguy540

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived timely and was exaclty what we were looking for. My husband was able to use it within 15 minutes of opening because set up was extrememly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Benedict

customer_reviews.title: This works great and is simple
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several ways of digitizing old slides. This works great and is simple!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Presley

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It works great and I am able ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works great and I am able to digitize all my old negatives and slides. Would buy again without a question. Highly recommend for anyone who has old negatives or slides they want to put on the computer or make digital.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Great I can see my slides back in the 60's ...
customer_reviews.text: Great I can see my slides back in the 60's and save them through USB onto the computer. It works well with color negative too. Glad to have this. .
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! I've gone through over a thousand slides and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I've gone through over a thousand slides and this has worked wonderfully. I've even blown up and ordered prints of some of the pictures with great results. You have to be careful of dust, but that's certainly not the scanners problem.
customer_reviews.author: louis b freund

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 5 months and all of a sudden it ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 5 months and all of a sudden it stopped working. I guess it just disposal like all the other crap made today. Do I need to buy a new one every 5 months????
customer_reviews.author: mlewis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and relatively fast. Slower if one uses the built-in adjustments for each slide.
customer_reviews.author: JohnW

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Produced quality digital photos better than expected. Easy to use and transfer to computer. Only complaint, some of my slides were difficult to push through the slide holder.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Hall

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quickly scans slides. Just push them thru. Only downside is the max size slide/negative is 35mm
customer_reviews.author: TenthWizard

customer_reviews.title: slide copier.
customer_reviews.text: it works well but thought it would be a little larger. needs to tilt back more.
customer_reviews.author: clarence p. becwar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My only complaint is that the screen is tiny and difficult to clearly see image before copying.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Spence

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service from Wolverine
customer_reviews.text: First one I got did not work. Amazon's 30-day warranty had passed before I decided to use it. The manufacturer replaced it. Great customer service from Wolverine! It does a fabulous job.
customer_reviews.author: Susan N. Cline

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for its price
customer_reviews.text: Quite easy to use for turning slides into Jpegs and the resolution looks good. Have not done much with the editing options as I put all the good slides through Photoshop afterwards and just delete the others. It would be nice if I could put the slides through a bit more quickly, but overall it is very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R. Manning

customer_reviews.title: you just pop it in and getting the pics on it is easy.
customer_reviews.text: I had never tried one of these, it is so simple and what a trip down memory lane. You do not need the removable disk, it can hook right up to your computer or laptop. If you do use the SanDisk so that you can send it to family and friends, you just pop it in and getting the pics on it is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great parents were very happy to get pictures off reels
customer_reviews.author: Maga

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for old slides... easy to use and good quality
customer_reviews.author: Ssthrone

customer_reviews.title: This worked much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This worked much better than I expected. Definitely well worth the cost. The only difficulty I had was do to the age of some of my slides some over 65 yrs old they were slightly warped and didn't slide through the feeder as easily as I had hoped, but that is more my problem than a product issue. I loved the clarity and the fact that I could make slides that were almost unrecognizable into pictures of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Button

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and works well with few slides but ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and works well with few slides but with larger number of slides problems with paper 2x2 slide in using adapter and advancing slides. Slide adapter should be more tolerant of slightly thicker slides, e.g. ektachrome, kodachrome.
customer_reviews.author: print man

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit...does the job. I did find that some slides cardboard film holders are just slightly too wide to slide easily thru the unit. The ones with rounded corners work just fine. Happy with the conversion process...works great.
customer_reviews.author: GMICROP

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this product.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic, not easy and too time consuming to do multiple slides, etc. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J Conklin

customer_reviews.title: It takes guesswork...,
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out the menu and instructions, it works fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: Iva Miller

customer_reviews.title: This is an easy to use machine
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use machine. I converted over 300 slides and was able to upload and sort with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Dawson

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: Slide converter worked well...converted more than 500 slides and can now view them on PC or TV. Works well for home use...I would recommend this item, not professional quality, but easy to use and does an adequate job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does a great job quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: i thought it auto pulled in the film but i understand why it doesn't though. does a great job quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is not a high-end product but it works pretty well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rufty Schandelmeier

customer_reviews.title: Work pretty good. It does for some reason attract a ...
customer_reviews.text: Work pretty good. It does for some reason attract a lot of dust on the lens that need to be clean on almost every negative which isn't difficult but just a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: super easy to use...color was pretty good for my 40 yo slides... fast for a single loader..

product_meta.title: ZONOZ FS-3 22MP All-in-1 Film & Slide Converter Scanner w/Speed-Load Adapters for 35mm, 126, 110 Negative & Slides, Super 8 Films - Includes Worldwide Voltage 110V/240V AC Adapter (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Color:FS-3 BlueZONOZ FS-3 22MP All-in-1 Film & Slide Converter Scanner w/Speed-Load Adapters for 35mm, 126, 110 Negative & Slides, Super 8 Films - Includes Worldwide Voltage 110V/240V AC Adapter (Blue) 

 The zonoz FS-THREE is the perfect device to scan and organize your old films or slides. This scanner houses an incredible image sensor that converts every detail and color contained in your films and slides. See the clarity and details on 2.4" color screen. With our unique and easy to use built-in software, you can also increase your scanning quality to an amazing 22 megapixels. Within seconds, the image scanner will scan, convert and save your old films and slides. You can now preserve your memories forever. 

 With our zonoz FS-THREE film scanner, you won't need anything else to get started. Using the film scanner is very easy with our intuitive design. Just load the film or slide onto the negatives or positives holder, and insert into place. Once the image appears, press "Scan". It is that easy. Your image has been scanned and saved to the FS-THREE's built-in memory. Items can also be saved to an SD card also (sold separately). 

 The zonoz FS-THREE also has some very convenient features like scanning resolution and brightness. You can also flip/mirror images to eliminate some simple loading errors. This amazing and portable film scanner is all you need to convert your old films and slides into permanent memories. 

 What's Included:
⚬ zonoz FS-THREE Scanner
⚬ Negative Adapter
⚬ Slide Adapter
⚬ 110 Insert
⚬ Super 8 Insert
⚬ USB Cable
⚬ Multi Voltage Power Adapter
⚬ TV Cable
⚬ Cleaning Brush User Manual
feature_bullets: Scan your old 35mm, 110, 126 Film Slides & Negatives and Super 8 Film
Simple Stand-Alone Operating Film & Negative Scanner - No Computer or Software Required
Store Images on Internal Storage or SD Memory Card (not included - compatible up to 32GB)
